questions.question: If you see orange construction signs and cones on a highway, you must:
choices: Stay alert for workers and equipment ahead
Slow down because the lane ends ahead
Decrease distance between you and any car ahead

questions.question: Which one of the following statements is true about seat belts?
choices: They help to protect you in a crash
Should only be used by adults 21 years or older
Shouldn't be used when driving 20 mph or slower

questions.question: In this situation (approaching the bicyclist from behind), you should:
choices: Honk your horn and pass on the other half of the roadway
Slow down, keep distance, and pass only when it is safe
Flash your headlights and pass on the other half of the roadway

questions.question: Which lane should you use for a left turn?
choices: Lane A with steady red X
Lane B with flashing yellow X
Lane C with steady green arrow

questions.question: This sign tells you:
choices: Left lane ends
There will be fewer lanes ahead
Traffic must merge right

questions.question: It is a good idea to give your horn a light tap when:
choices: You want another driver to get out of the way
Passing a driver who starts to turn into your lane
Passing a bicycle in a narrow lane

questions.question: Under ideal conditions, which method helps you determine a safe following distance between you and the vehicle ahead?
choices: Using a four-second rule
Flashing your headlights
Using a three-car-length rule

questions.question: When approaching another vehicle from behind at night, at what distance should you dim your headlights?
choices: 500 feet
1,000 feet
300 feet

questions.question: Signaling before making a turn is:
choices: Required by law
Common courtesy, but not required by law
Required by law in urban areas only

questions.question: This is the shape and color of a:
choices: Wrong way sign
Yield sign
Stop sign

questions.question: Your headlights suddenly go out. To get them working again, you should:
choices: Try the headlight switch a few times
Pumping your brake pedal a few times
Turning the ignition on and off

questions.question: You should always be alert to the presence of motorcyclists and be extra cautious because:
choices: Motorcycles must share your lane
Motorcycles are smaller and harder to see
Motorcycles always have the right-of-way

questions.question: Where must you stop at an intersection with a stop sign and crosswalk lines but no stop line?
choices: At the crosswalk
On the other side of the crosswalk lines
At the second parallel crosswalk line

questions.question: When you see other drivers around you acting or reacting in anger, you should:
choices: Avoid eye contact
Honk your horn
Speed up or block the lane

questions.question: After stopping and yielding, a left turn into a one-way street on a red light is:
choices: Allowed from both one-way and two-way streets
Allowed from a one-way street only
Never allowed

questions.question: To be aware of and be alert to any hazards that may appear while driving, you should:
choices: Keep as close as possible to any vehicle ahead
Keep your eyes still and focus straight ahead
Always know what is happening around your vehicle

questions.question: When can you drive around or under a lowered gate at a railroad crossing?
choices: When no red light is flashing
When no gongs are sounding
Under no circumstances

questions.question: You should adjust your seat and mirrors:
choices: After you start driving
Before you get into your vehicle
Before you drive

questions.question: Double parking is allowed:
choices: Where there is a white colored curb
In no situation
On one-way streets

questions.question: The wrong way sign means:
choices: Driving in the direction you are going is not allowed
You may not drive in this direction unless it is safe to do so
Road ahead is closed to traffic in all directions

questions.question: Which is true about giving your horn a sharp blast?
choices: Never blast your horn to encourage someone to drive faster
It is only recommended when you cannot see well ahead
Do this only to apprise other drivers of an error

questions.question: Tractor-trailers and large trucks:
choices: Need less room to make a turn
Take longer to stop than cars
Have smaller blind spots than most cars

questions.question: To prevent skidding on slippery surfaces, you should:
choices: Adjust speed to road conditions
Accelerate quickly after a stop
Turn the wheel sharply and firm at all turns

questions.question: Keeping a safe following distance using a four-second rule means:
choices: The rule gives you time and distance to respond to problems
You can use the same rule no matter road or weather conditions
The distance in yards does not change with different speeds

questions.question: You may cross a double solid yellow line:
choices: To turn left if it is safe
To overtake vehicles that aren't keeping up with traffic flow
When there is no traffic coming the other way

questions.question: When driving in a roundabout, you should:
choices: Change lane before exiting
Not stop inside the roundabout
Pass to the left of large vehicles

questions.question: Using a seat belt:
choices: Is the single most effective thing you can do to protect yourself in a crash
Is not necessary when you drive 20 mph or slower
Is only necessary if your car isn't equipped with airbags

questions.question: You see this sign ahead. What should you do?
choices: Test your brakes
Stop ahead
Slow down and drive carefully

questions.question: You are driving on a rural highway. You see an orange diamond-shaped road sign far ahead. The sign will:
choices: Mark the beginning of a no-passing zone
Warn you of road works ahead
Indicate a new speed limit

questions.question: This sign tells you:
choices: Making a U-turn at the intersection is not allowed
Turning right at the intersection is not allowed
You must not drive into a street in the direction you are going

questions.question: If a vehicle comes toward you with high beams on, you can be blinded if you:
choices: Flash your own headlights to alert the other driver
Slow down and look to the right side of the road
Look at the other vehicle's headlights

questions.question: To back up on a freeway:
choices: Is allowed if there is a paved shoulder
Is allowed if you do not interfere with other traffic
Is always illegal

questions.question: If you are traveling in lane B (beneath a steady yellow X), you must:
choices: Change lane in a safe manner
Stop
Turn left

questions.question: How far down the road should you look when you drive on an open highway?
choices: At least 15 seconds
No more than 3-4 seconds
About 2 seconds

questions.question: You approach an intersection where school bus is stopped on the cross street. The bus displays flashing red lights. What should you do?
choices: Always stop
Stop, but only if you intend to turn into the cross street
Slow down and pass carefully if you are going straight ahead

questions.question: If your brakes stop working, what could you do to build up enough brake pressure to allow you to stop?
choices: Brake very hard and keep braking
Pump the brake pedal several times
Press the gas pedal and brake pedal at the same time

questions.question: Anti-lock brakes are most effective when you:
choices: Apply the handbrake
Brake promptly and firmly
Brake gently

questions.question: When approaching a stopped emergency vehicle with activated lights on a four-lane roadway, you must:
choices: Move over one lane if possible
Keep your speed and not stop
Turn on your headlights

questions.question: Before getting out of your parked car on the traffic side of a street, you should:
choices: Check traffic
Briefly flash your emergency lights
Turn on your turn signal

questions.question: If you see a vehicle driving with an unsecured load, you should:
choices: Stay as far away as possible and call 911
Stay close behind and warn the driver by using your horn
Turn on emergency flashers and quickly overtake the vehicle

questions.question: A sign with this shape means:
choices: Stop
Do not enter
Warning

questions.question: A traffic signal showing a steady yellow light means:
choices: Caution
Stop
Yield

questions.question: Alcohol reaches your brain in:
choices: One hour
5-10 minutes
20 to 40 minutes

questions.question: If the roadway is slippery and your car starts to skid, you should:
choices: Stay off the brake and steer in the direction you want to go
Slow down by pumping your brakes quickly and firmly
Slow down by shifting to a lower gear

questions.question: You will often see this sign:
choices: Near railroad crossings
Near bridges and overpasses
Near intersections

questions.question: This red and white sign means:
choices: You must come to a complete stop. Proceed only when safe
The road is closed to traffic from your direction
The road is closed to traffic from all directions

questions.question: If you park facing uphill on a street with a curb and turn the front wheels to the left:
choices: The curb will stop the car from rolling into the street
Back of the car will roll into the street if the brakes fail
Front of the car will roll into the street if the brakes fail

questions.question: When oncoming traffic prevents you from making an immediate left turn, you should:
choices: Start turning, oncoming traffic will always stop
Alert oncoming traffic by using horn or headlights
Slow down and stop if necessary

questions.question: If you are using the left-hand lane to pass slower traffic and someone tailgates you, it is best to:
choices: Speed up to lose the tailgater
Turn on emergency flasher to discourage the tailgater
Move back into the right-hand lane when it is safe to do so

questions.question: A two-way left turn lane should be used for:
choices: Passing slower vehicles
Left turns from both directions
Accelerating before merging with traffic

questions.question: In general, you should avoid using your horn:
choices: When another driver may have trouble seeing you
When a child is about to run into the street
When passing a child on a bicycle

questions.question: Avoid passing another vehicle:
choices: At a railroad crossing
On one-way streets
On roads with center lines

questions.question: Which is true about alcohol?
choices: It improves your accuracy of steering and braking
It is a major cause of death in car accidents
It helps you stay awake and active

questions.question: If you are under 21 years, you can be arrested for a THC/marijuana level of:
choices: More than 0.00 nanograms per milliliter of blood
No less than 8.00 nanograms per milliliter of blood
No less than 5.00 nanograms per milliliter of blood

questions.question: If a pedestrian is crossing at an intersection and is in your half of the roadway:
choices: You must slow down and yield the right-of-way
You must slow down and pass with caution
You must stop

questions.question: Driving within the range of your headlights means:
choices: Adjusting your speed so you can stop within the distance you can see ahead with your headlights
Always using high beams when driving faster than 40 mph
Using low beams when driving slower than 40 mph

questions.question: What does this sign mean?
choices: School zone
No bicyclists
Bicycle crossing

questions.question: When are you allowed to drink alcohol while driving?
choices: When you are 21 years or older
When you drive outside city limits
In no situation

questions.question: Areas around a large truck where other vehicles may disappear into blind spots are located to:
choices: The sides of the truck only
The front and rear only
Both sides, rear, and front of the truck

questions.question: You have an intermediate license. A friend under 20 years may be with you while you drive:
choices: Your friend holds a valid driver's license or intermediate license
If you have held the intermediate license for more than six months
Under no circumstances

questions.question: You approach this road sign. What does it tell you?
choices: The divided highway on which you are traveling ends ahead
There will be fewer lanes ahead
The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways

questions.question: When you see other drivers around you acting or reacting in anger, you should:
choices: Flash your headlights
Honk your horn
Distance yourself from the situation

questions.question: If you are involved in a crash, you must always:
choices: Report it to Washington Department of Transportation
Immediately move injured people out of the traffic lane
Stop at the scene or close by

questions.question: When must you stop at a railroad crossing?
choices: When pavement markings before the crossing include a stop line
When flashing red lights are activated
When there is more than one track

questions.question: Always look carefully for motorcycles before you make a left turn because:
choices: They are not required to use left-turn lanes
The small size makes them harder to see
They always have the right-of-way at intersections

questions.question: What do pavement markings in the center of this road indicate?
choices: An evacuation lane
A shared left turn lane
A median that must not be crossed

questions.question: On cold, wet days, which of the following roadways is most likely to hide spots of ice?
choices: Roadways on hilltops
Roadways on bridges and overpasses
Roadways paved with asphalt

questions.question: When it is hard for you to see ahead because of darkness or bad weather, you should:
choices: Increase your following distance
Turn on your interior light
Speed up to get off the road quickly

questions.question: Before turning left, it is essential to:
choices: Move to the right side of your lane
Yield to oncoming vehicles
Sound your horn

questions.question: If it feels like your tires have lost traction with the surface of the road, you should:
choices: Try to steer off the road
Slow down gradually
Step firmly on the brake

questions.question: When you park parallel to a curb on a city street, you should:
choices: Leave three feet of clearance between your vehicle and the curb
Turn on headlights
Check traffic before you get out

questions.question: Before changing lanes, it is essential to:
choices: Only use the inside rear-view mirror
Slow down
Look over your shoulder to make sure the lane is clear

questions.question: Braking in a curve:
choices: Is the best way to avoid an accident
Will help tires to grip the road
Can cause your vehicle to skid

questions.question: If you have a flat tire or blowout while driving, you should take your foot off the gas pedal and:
choices: Immediately steer to the right side of the road
Immediately steer to the left side of the road
Steer straight ahead

questions.question: Roads freeze more quickly when they are:
choices: Shaded
Flat
Curvy

questions.question: What does this sign mean?
choices: Merge ahead
Yield ahead
Stop ahead

questions.question: What does this sign mean?
choices: Do not enter
Always stop completely and yield to other traffic
Yield the right-of-way to other traffic

questions.question: A flashing yellow light means:
choices: Slow down and proceed with caution
All other traffic is stopped by a red light
Stop, the light is about to change

questions.question: Drivers turning left must:
choices: Alert oncoming vehicles and make sure they stop
Yield to oncoming vehicles
Turn even if there are oncoming vehicles

questions.question: When parking on any hill or sloping street, facing uphill or downhill, it is essential to:
choices: Set your parking brake and leave the vehicle in gear or in the park position
Let the front wheels point straight ahead unless there is a curb
Always park at least two feet from the curb or side of the road

questions.question: When a big rig is signaling for a right turn ahead, you can expect the driver to:
choices: Wait for you to pass
Move to the left before turning
Make a tight and sharp turn

questions.question: When entering a shared center lane reserved for making left turns, you should enter this lane:
choices: At least 500 feet before the turn
Between 250 feet and 500 feet before the turn
No more than 300 feet before the turn

questions.question: Which of the following is marked with solid white lines?
choices: Lanes of traffic moving in opposite directions
Highway medians between two roadways
Bicycle lanes

questions.question: If you want to turn left in the path of an oncoming motorcyclist who signals a right turn, you should:
choices: Be sure the motorcycle is turning before you move on
Turn quickly and allow room for the motorcyclist
Speed up and sound your horn

questions.question: Failing to settle a civil court judgment resulting from a collision can result in a suspension for:
choices: Up to three years
One year
13 or more years

questions.question: When driving at night when there may be people along the side of the road, you should:
choices: Turn on high-beam headlights
Flash headlights as a warning
Slow down to 20 mph or less

questions.question: It is against the law to drive around a lowered gate or ignore the flashing lights at a railroad crossing:
choices: Even if you don't see a train coming
Unless there is only one track and gates have been lowered for more than 3 minutes
Unless you proceed across tracks with your four-way flashers activated
